Name: Marmalade Cocktail
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix) optional
1 dash Orange Bitters by Angostura optional
3 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: STIR 3 flat barspoons of marmalade (15-20ml) with other ingredients in base of shaker to dissolve the marmalade. SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: As Harry Craddock says of his own drink, "By its bitter-sweet taste this cocktail is especially suited to be a luncheon aperitif."
History: Adapted from a recipe in Harry Craddock's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book .
